revision.text:
'''Gyms''' are special areas in Pokéclicker where the player can earn gym badges and unlock new routes by defeating the gym leader in a battle. There are 8 gyms in each region plus the Pokémon League building, which includes the Elite 4 trainers and the champion. revision.comment: Added commas for digit grouping, to make the larger numbers more readable.

revision.text:
'''Gyms''' are special areas in Pokéclicker where the player can earn gym badges and unlock new routes by defeating the gym leader in a battle. There are 8 gyms in each region plus the Pokémon League building, which includes the Elite 4 trainers and the champion. revision.comment: Added all Kalos information, meaning this page is up to date. Trainer sprites missing.

revision.text:
'''Gyms''' are special areas in Pokéclicker where the player can earn gym badges and unlock new routes by defeating the gym leader in a battle. There are 8 gyms in each region plus the Pokémon League building, which includes the Elite 4 trainers and the champion. revision.text:
'''Gyms''' are special areas in Pokéclicker where the player can earn gym badges and unlock new routes by defeating the gym leader in a battle. There are 8 gyms in each region plus the Pokémon League building, which includes the Elite 4 trainers and the champion. [[File:Badge case.png|thumb|350px]] ==[[Kanto]]== ===Gyms=== {| class="wikitable collapsible" style="text-align: center;" |- ! Location !! Badge !! Leader !! Money Earned !! Pokémon !! HP !! revision.text:
'''Gyms''' are special areas in Pokéclicker where the player can earn gym badges and unlock new routes by defeating the gym leader in a battle. There are 8 gyms in each region plus the Pokémon League building, which includes the Elite 4 trainers and the champion. revision.text:
'''Gyms''' are special areas in Pokéclicker where the player can earn gym badges and unlock new routes by defeating the gym leader in a battle. There are 8 gyms in each region plus the Pokémon League building, which includes the Elite 4 trainers and the champion. [[File:Badge case.png|thumb|350px]] ==[[Kanto]]== ===Gyms=== {| class="wikitable collapsible" style="text-align: center;" |- ! Location !! Badge !! Leader !! Money Earned !! Pokémon !! HP !! revision.text:
'''Gyms''' are special areas in Pokéclicker where the player can earn gym badges and unlock new routes by defeating the gym leader in a battle. There are 8 gyms in each region plus the Pokémon League building, which includes the Elite 4 trainers and the champion. [[File:Badge case.png|thumb|350px]] ==[[Kanto]]== ===Gyms=== {| class="wikitable collapsible" style="text-align: center;" |- ! Location !! Badge !! Leader !! Money Earned !! Pokémon !! HP !! '''Gyms''' are special areas in Pokéclicker where the player can earn gym badges and unlock new routes by defeating the gym leader in a battle. There are 8 gyms in each region plus the Pokémon League building, which includes the Elite 4 trainers and the champion. revision.comment: Cinnabar Island's Gym Leader is not Blane. His name is Blaine.

revision.text:
'''Gyms''' are special areas in Pokéclicker where the player can earn gym badges and unlock new routes by defeating the gym leader in a battle. There are 8 gyms in each region plus the Pokémon League building, which includes the Elite 4 trainers and the champion. '''Gyms''' are special areas in Pokéclicker where the player can earn gym badges and unlock new routes by defeating the gym leader in a battle. There are 8 gyms in each region plus the Pokémon League building, which includes the Elite 4 trainers and the champion. '''Gyms''' are special areas in Pokéclicker where the player can earn gym badges and unlock new routes by defeating the gym leader in a battle. There are 8 gyms in each region plus the Pokémon League building, which includes the Elite 4 trainers and the champion. '''Gyms''' are special areas in Pokéclicker where the player can earn gym badges and unlock new routes by defeating the gym leader in a battle. There are 8 gyms in each region plus the Pokémon League building, which includes the Elite 4 trainers and the champion.
